page.title: 20FINDING OUT ABOUT FELTWELL
page.content: The information about Feltwell was collected by the children of Edmund de Moundeford School, mostly nine or ten years old. We talked to prominent people in the village also businesspeople and ordinary residents. We talked to about ten percent of the residents. We went out and looked carefully at each of our kilometre squares, helped by people who knew them well. Almost all of the people we talked to were very helpful but some of them could not understand what we were doing. About the village people said "A nice quiet place to live" "More entertainment needed for all ages" A few thought the place was dirty and some living nearer Hockwold didn't like co-operating with Feltwell School.
